Situation1: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Expectation2: Fix bugs and troubleshoot issues reported by users or QA
Situation2: Several users report intermittent errors that disrupt normal usage
Story: It’s Friday evening, and I’m sitting across from my boyfriend at our favorite café, trying to focus on his stories, but my phone keeps buzzing. He’s leaving for Germany on Monday, and this is our last weekend together for months. I want to be present, to laugh at his jokes, to memorize the way he smiles, but Slack notifications keep popping up—urgent bug reports, users unable to log in, QA tagging me for immediate fixes. My manager’s messages are polite but insistent: “Can you take a look tonight?” I nod along to my boyfriend’s plans for the weekend, but my mind is split, torn between the code that needs patching and the moments I’m supposed to cherish. I feel guilty for even glancing at my phone, but the anxiety of letting my team down gnaws at me. He reaches for my hand, and I force a smile, heart pounding, knowing I can’t be in two places at once.
